project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi,

The new feature to specify the # of cards per TASK BOARD column only applies to summary cards.

If you have a very wide resolution, e.g. dual monitor, you want to be able to display many cards across the width of each column, not one that stretches to be very wide per column as it is now.

Cheers,

Ximon
fields.summary: New ability to specify # cards per column should also apply to CARD view

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi,

If you think about a real white board the sticky notes will often have very short descriptions of the issues in large writing so it can be easily seen.

I have found that in our daily standups teams are struggling to see what is on the cards and that our summary strings are quite short and that the ability to show them in a large bold font on the card would be v useful.

Cheers,

Ximon
fields.summary: Use large bold font for summary text on summary card view

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi,

In 2.5.1 the CREATE NEW ISSUE link causes an issue type popup followed by an iframe containing the Issue Navigator create issue UI. In 3.0 this is changed, the JIRA project/issue type selection screen appears entirely replacing the GH screen which means if I cancel it I lose where I was, instead I end up at my dashboard / HOME.

Cheers,

Ximon

(!) Update: I set this to Blocker priority because there are several issues with the new create issue dialog functionality but it isn't possible to just go back to using the built-in JIRA issue creation functionality without penality because of this issue which introduces extra clicks as even on completion of issue creation you are STILL not sent back to the TASK BOARD where you were.
fields.summary: GH 3.0 "CREATE NEW ISSUE" link above TASK BOARD doesn't obey use iframe setting

fields.description: The "assigned to me" checkbox should only affect what is shown in the list/summary/card view, NOT what can be shown in the IFrame popup or in search results. If I click the issue link of a parent task in list view for example I expect to see it popup in the IFrame, not be told I am not allowed to view it because my context is set to "assigned to me" only.

fields.description:
Hi,

It occured to me that managers sitting in a different building or part of a building might not want to keep asking the managers if the TASK BOARD is up to date, but instead it might be nice to show on the top of the TASK BOARD the most recent date that any issue currently visible on the board was updated.
fields.summary: Show "Last updated" on the TASK BOARD

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
While in a standup today I was watching the team and realised that while one person is talking another will lean in towards the board and lift the sticky notes a little toward him/her just scanning around to see if any issues are related to what is being said, trying to get a better view of what is on the note.

I realised the same could be very valuable in GreenHopper, a way to move the mouse over an issue and have it zoom. The double click is noisy/intrusive (e.g. double tap on a touch screen is quite loud and tends to need to be repeated) & causes the card to jump, but a gradual (rapid) zoom to a large size which obscures the cards beneath it would be v cool/useful.
fields.summary: Card zooming

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Sometimes on our white boards you see people have made individual sticky notes for the detailed sub-tasks and they overlap these in a way similar to the old Windows 3 "Cascade" window organisation mode, e.g. see attached.
fields.summary: Card cascade

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We use Jira/GH and competitive tool in parallel so I see the release planning tools amongst the biggest missing parts in GH. 
The reports/charts in GH are based on historical data, but no estimates are made based on the velocity and backlog change pace. For example it would be nice to be able to have a rough prediction of a possible release date that is based on the remaining story points in the backlog + average changes calculated based on historical data and the velocity of the team. These projections would make it easier to keep track of the project and plan further releases.
Basically when you fix release date you need to plan what stories could be included and if you take into account only two dimensions - velocity and CURRENT backlog content you produce wrong estimate. Of course it won't work for release 1.0 but already 1.1 could be planned with quite reasonable accuracy.
Would it be possible to add such chart?
fields.summary: Release planning chart

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
From Atlassian: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-11669

I had to edit and repackage the greenhopper plugin myself on our production JIRA server because the logs reached 9 GB and killed the system, due to these messages spewing out about missing the $req.contextPath variable.  Replacing as directed above fixed the problem.  

It is a trivial fix, I hope you can get it into 3.0 for Friday.  thx.
fields.summary: $req.contextPath must be replaced with $requestContext.baseUrl

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
My TaskBoard.jsp is 600KB+ in size, not including the combined-boards-2.5.1.js.

When looking why I found a line that contains this pattern:

{noformat}el.options[el.length]= new Option("aabo","aabo");
if(sel == "aabo")el.options[el.length-1].selected=true;{noformat}

It does this for 2659 users !!!! My project only has a handful of users.

The JS and CSS (although the CSS is minimal) are almost 600KB in size on their own, not including combined-boards-2.5.1.js!

The culprits are the setPOptions(), setAOptions() and setReporterOptions() JS functions.
fields.summary: TaskBoard.jspa contains JS for all JIRA users, not just those in the project

fields.description:
COS:
- User is logged in and loads the Rapid Board, returns to the page after being logged out in another tab (either via cookie timeout or logout) and gets a [notification that they are not logged in|https://support.atlassian.com/login.jsp?permissionViolation=true&os_destination=%2Fbrowse%2FJSP-79222]
- Once they login they are returned to the Rapid Board view they were previously at


If I come back to my GH screen after being away for a while my JIRA login might have timed out. If say the first thing I do is an action that I would normally expect to see the GH spinner for it can be very confusing doing it once my session is timed out 'cause it just spins and spins and spins and I have to force a page reload before I can click anything.

fields.description:
Hi,

We have projects with lots and lots of JIRA versions that will not be released or archived, but we don't want them cluttering the PLANNING BOARD (e.g. we have 5 or 6 pages of versions). I tried using a filter that only matched certain versions but noticed that GH doesn't use the filter to determine which version boxes to draw.

Since it isn't possible to show more than the fixed number of versions that GH shows on the PLANNING BOARD perhaps a filterable set of versions is a good idea? (for situations when you cannot release or archive the versions).

Ximon
fields.summary: Allow JIRA filter to filter the versions shown in the PLANNING BOARD

fields.description:
Use case:

ISSUE-1 belongs to 2 fixVersions:
   "Thing A - Release 1.1"
   "Sprint 2"

(It also belongs to a component called "Thing A", but this is not particularly important). These two JIRA versions are being used to track the current sprint and also the overall version release.

If the issue is dragged from version "Sprint 2" to version "Sprint 3" in the planning board, the association with "Thing A - Release 1.1" is lost. This is bad! Not only are we losing information, but it is lost silently with no indication to the user.

It was suggested to me by a colleage that this can be handled by using GreenHopper's version "Master" feature: if we made "Component A - Release 1.1" a master of "Sprint 2" and of "Sprint 3" then moving this issue from Sprint 2 to 3 would retain the assocation with "Thing A - Release 1.1". 

However, this only works if *all* items in your sprint are associated with a given 'master' version. It does *not* work if your project has multiple concurrent arallel release streams, and issues for more than one of those streams are being worked on in a single sprint. For instance, if you have two components, each component may have their own "next release", as a JIRA version:

JIRA version: "Thing A - Release 1.1"
JIRA version: "Thing B - Release 2.7"

(Note that this has nothing to do with JIRA Components - it makes sense that issues under "Thing B - Release 2.7" would also be associated with a component called "Thing B", but this is orthogonal to versioning and use of the Planning Board in "versions" mode).

In this scenario, we're working on both of these components towards their respective releases in all of our sprints, e.g.:

ISSUE-1 belongs to 2 fixVersions (as before):
   "Thing A - Release 1.1"
   "Sprint 2"

ISSUE-2 belongs to 2 fixVersions:
   "Thing B - Release 2.7"
   "Sprint 2"

If I make "Thing A - Release 1.1" a master of Sprint 2, then dragging ISSUE-2 from Sprint 2 to Sprint 3 loses its association with "Thing B - Release 2.7".
If I make "Thing B - Release 2.7" a master of Sprint 2, then dragging ISSUE-1 from Sprint 2 to Sprint 3 loses its association with "Thing A - Release 1.1".

i.e., we get exactly the same problem as originally described.

I can't make both of them a master of Sprint 2 since this is not supported by GH. It would not make sense to support it either, because that would imply that ALL Issues within Sprint 2 belong to both of the releases - this is clearly not the case.

Therefore the only correct solution I can think of is to ensure that dragging from "Sprint 2" to "Sprint 3" *only* removes the association with "Sprint 2" and adds association to "Sprint 3" - *and does not remove any other existing fixVersion associations*.

The only time it may be acceptable to remove fixversion associations is if you manually do a "synchronise".

Thanks,
Baris.
fields.summary: Planning board: Dragging an issue from one fixversion to another should *only* remove the fixversion it is being dragged from,  not all other versions

fields.description:
If flagging a sub parent should be flagged automatically if not already flagged.
If unflagging a sub the parent should also be unflagged if no subs are flagged
if unflagginf a parent all subs should alos be unflagged
fields.summary: Enhance the flagging system between Parents and sub-tasks

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Very annoying to have to click on configuration just to change the number of issues to display.
These settings should be accessible in the boards.
fields.summary: As a GH user I would like to be able to change my preferences within the boards.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Bind CTRL+A to select all

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The last visited project of a user will be persisted in the database.
So the next time the user clicks on a menu item, GH will present the last project that the user has visited.

Today it is based on the session value that JIRA keeps but this one seems to be swiped out rapidly or after ending a session, restarting JIRA and so on.
fields.summary: GH should persist the last visited project so that the menu items redirect users more adequatly to the GreenHopper boards.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi,

I have an issue which when viewed in the JIRA issue navigator gives me the option to use the "Start Testing Progress" action, but the link for this action is not being rendered on the card in the TASK BOARD. See screenshots.
fields.summary: Workflow action link missing

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Is this a regression, or am I going mad? I thought the flag exclamation used to be visible (albeit clipped) during list mode on the PLANNING BOARD?
fields.summary: Flag exclamation doesn't show in list mode, but used to?

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi, flagging works in both the TASK BOARD and PLANNING BOARD so the flagging field configuration should be in Configuration -> GENERAL, not Configuration -> PLANNING BOARD.
fields.summary: Flag configuration should be in GENERAL, not PLANNING BOARD

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If a user doesnt have rights to transition an issue and tries to transition a parent task from the outlined parent view of the taskboard
a modal screen popups - GOOD
Clicking on Ok doesnt close the popup - BAD
fields.summary: Cannot close the modal error screen in the outlined view of the TaskBoard triggered by a failed transition of a parent task.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When the issues won't fit on one page and paging links are shown how about having a link to "Show All" ?
fields.summary: "Show All" link next to page links

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In some screen resolutions in CARD view the parent issue link on a sub-task card merges with or obscures the action link (e.g. I have a transition from IN PROGRESS to READY FOR TESTING which shows the transition name "Ready For Testing" in the top right corner of the card).

This is particularly an issue on large touch flat screens or beamer projector displays which cannot be made to be higher resolution but are frequently used in team environments.

Additionally, the textual transition link is quite hard to press on a touch screen but is used in a comparable situation to dragging a card between columns and so needs to be easy.

Would it be possible when entering drag mode to show a drag target area under or above the card (depending on where there is most screen space) showing translucent "buckets" to drop the card into for additional statuses that are represented in the same column the card is already in?
fields.summary: Improved action link appearance needed

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: See summary.
fields.summary: New sub-tasks rank above old sub-tasks. Add option to rank them below instead of above.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a GH user I when I click CREATE NEW ISSUE in GreenHopper and I have IFrame mode enabled I want the IFrame to close when I submit the create issue JIRA form so that I return to where I was before.

This is probably obsoleted by future functionality enabling creation of new issues via GH cards.
fields.summary: Close IFrame on add

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Today during a sprint planning meeting I noticed that the team were using IE 6 in a monitor resolution of 1366x768 and the vertical right hand side scroll bar in the GH IFrame was almost entirely drawn off the right hand edge of the IFrame.
fields.summary: RHS scroll bar almost drawn off RHS of IFrame in IE

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi,

Depending on your screen resolution the IFrame can be quite frustrating. For example today the vertical scroll bar on the right hands side (in IE) was almost entirely off the edge of the IFrame and so very hard to drag using a touch screen :) Also a JIRA page that would fit nicely in a full screen window doesn't always fit nicely in the IFrame.

However, the benefit of not losing your context in the PLANNING BOARD or TASK BOARD when closing the IFrame makes the IFrame invaluable.

So, it occured to me, what about a compromise? Why not make it so that GH opens a full size IFrame completely covering the GH window, but that when closed takes you back to your previous GH context.

Thoughts?
fields.summary: Maximised IFrame mode

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The planning board list view doesn't seem to always show sub-tasks correctly nested under the parent. 
The attached screenshow shows an example where many children are correct, and some are not.
fields.summary: List view doesn't show sub-tasks correctly

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The method getElementByClassName() doesnt work in Firefox 3.0
It is deprecated anyhoe in Prototype

We should be using *$$* instead.
fields.summary: Support Firefox 3.0

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Right now some users like the iFrame and some do not.  Would be good if users could turn this on or off for themselves, not just per-project.

Note: an alternative suggestion would be to eliminate this setting or change it such that you always provided two links instead of one: one that opens up the item in a normal browser window, and another that opens up the iFrame.  That may be ideal, because the truth is sometimes you want to pop it up in an iFrame and other times you want to open it up in a separate tab.  This, if you can fit the two links on the UI, would definitely be ideal.
fields.summary: Allow per-user JIRA iFrame configuration

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
On the Task Board tasks with sub tasks have text that is cut off like "11 s" "3 su" instead of "11 subs" or "3 subs" also subtasks used to have a link to the original issue, now the link is chopped off.  See the screenshot.  I highlighted the cut off links using orange rectangles

Note it is even cut off on my wide-screen notebook PC
fields.summary: The {Subs} link on the task board is signifcantly cut off / illegable in v2.5.1

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Show new card creation view ,
With all fields specified by the user in card configuration screen
Add Required fields if not already in card configuration selected field for the specific subtask issue type
Check field permission 
Version presets to parent issue version , version will be read only
Explore the possibility to use Jira SoapClient API
fields.summary: Create a subtask directly via card view

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Use the extra space for summary text when no field is assigned to the right most slot in list view card configuration. See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Use empty slot space for summary in list view

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
After upgrading to 2.5 auto assign was disabled for all our users. Since part of the work flow is based on this feature, I would like to have the ability to overriding it as admin. Perhaps it should not be editable by normal users at all.

http://www.greenpeppersoftware.com/site/posts/list/219.page#4167
fields.summary: Please allow administrators to override auto assign

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Would like all new projects to take their settings from the administration area "defaults." Right now if you create a ranking, story points, etc fields a user is required to set it up in every project. I would like it to default to specific settings, then allow someone to override the settings if needed on a per project bases. This should include the sorting context, cards, etc.
fields.summary: Default/Global Greenhopper Settings

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
This used to work fine - now they are cut off.  We really need this fixed to use 2.5.1
See attached screenshot before and after.

Seems the corner card field is taking up way more space than it used to.  Possible for us to get a quick fix for this issue since we were waiting on 2.5.1 and currently running 2.4
fields.summary: Assignee names are cut off and illegable on small cards in 2.5.1

fields.summary: Just installed and unable to use planning board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Main goal is to narrow down the possible selections.
fields.summary: As a GH user I would like to be able to apply a context on the ranking selections.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: We have about 300 projects and only some of them use GreenHopper for various reasons. Currently it's really hard to configure them with ctrl-clicks and trying to avoid clearing all selections. A better solution could be two lists where you would move projects that will use GreenHopper from left list to right list or something similar.
fields.summary: GreenHopper applicable context configuration should be more user friendly with big list of projects

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I want to define User Stories to manage my work. I would like to be able to create a User Story, and then let engineering create the list of tasks that they need to complete for the story to be considered done. 

However, most people I work with don't use User Stories (yet), but they all use Task cards in JIRA/Greenhopper.  It would be a easy transition if I could associate a group of existing Tasks with User Stories. This would allow business to continue as usual, and still allow me to have  higher level abstraction to manage my work- and at the appropriate time show others the metrics in terms of User Stories and Story Points.
fields.summary: I want to associate a group of existing tasks with a new or existing User Story.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: I would like to be able to create a User Story, and then let engineering create the list of tasks that they need to complete for the story to be considered done. Conversely, I want to associate existing Tasks with User Stories.
fields.summary: Associate a Story with Tasks (1-to-many)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Clicking on the summary clock in the TaskBaord doesnt bring up the LogWork inputs but the card itself

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: As a GH user I would like to be able to expand/collapse my parent tasks to hide the subtasks in the list view

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: It happens when a subtasks is the first issue in a column and in the compact view.
fields.summary: Sometimes the TaskBoard's colunms are not fully drawn making it impossible to dropa card in a colunm

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When beginning a new milestone/sprint, we find it a bit cumbersome to hand out the backlog of tasks to members of the team and retain balanced workloads. Currently we assign a few, then reload a different page to get a summary of the times assigned to each user, then flip back and assign a few more... It would be very handy if we could use something like the planning board to drag tasks to users to assign issues (like we can for fix versions) and have the assigned times tally up for the for the users on the right. Ideally we'd be able to show only the users in a specific group (or at the least, a comma separated list of explicit user names).
fields.summary: As a manager I would like to be able to  "plan" by users

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Ranking field in Issue view sometimes dont trigger the selection pane in IE

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: See attached screenshot. At first I thought the card contents were spilling outside the card boundary but then I realised that actually the card contents are still inside the area that I can use to drag the card, so maybe the card border is simply not drawing as far out as the drag border.
fields.summary: Card border is not drawn as large as the card contents or the card selection area

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
See attached wink videos (one of which is very hand edited to include explanations of what is happening frame by frame).

The problem seems to be (in both FireFox and IE) that the yellow card highlight rectangle (that appears on an issue when it is transitioned from one status to another (whether by being dragged between columns or by the use of a transition link in the top right of the card detail view)) doesn't fade entirely as it should.
fields.summary: Yellow highlight doesn't fade as it should.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: See summary (or in my local English "Like it says on the tin" :D)
fields.summary: "Sorry! Action denied. Your JIRA workflow forbids this move" dialog *entire OK button should be clickable, not just the OK text.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The method loadJavascript doesnt work properly in IE since IE loads all page before displaying it.
Occures only when the filters portlet is not load up.

Workaround:
Need to refresh dashboard to load all portlets or include the JIRA filters portlet.
fields.summary: GreenHopper portlets sometimes dont load up in IE

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It seems to be appearing after every nighlty GreenHopper service execution.
Not for all projects taht are ranked

Workarround - fix
For GreenHopper to show the ranking back we need to click on the "hand" in the planning board and then on *optimize*.
fields.summary: In some cases GreenHopper indicates "Issue not Rankable"

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
JIRA allows to associate a wiki renderer to fields. It is useful for multi-line fileds like description.

Currently, the field is not rendered in the card.
fields.summary: Improve rendering of fields with wiki rendering activated

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
See the screenshots taken in GHS-498.  While the listview summary font is the same as the task board in v2.5, it is smaller than it was in listview in v2.4.  While this may be desired by some people, us product owners with tired eyes would prefer the larger font to ease the pain of reviewing a ton of issues.  There is room for the larger font since the Jira issue number shown in v.25 ListView still uses the larger font that v2.4 used for the summary too.

If the smaller font was desired by more people, could we at least have the option?
fields.summary: List view summary font is smaller in v2.5 than in v2.4 making it harder to read

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Instead the field is displayed immediately after the Versions field (centered instead of right-justified?) , which makes it harder to read.  The field should be right justified.  See attached screenshots of Before and After.
fields.summary: List view no longer shows "Corner" field right justified like v2.4 did

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Also find a way to limit the drop down size (Version/Component).
That will avoid board headers to freak. :)
fields.summary: Long version/component names wraps in the summary making the content to be displayed out of bounds.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Corner value in list view line are not right align

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Recipe:

* TASK BOARD
* Click the '-' sign on the OTHER ISSUES row
* It stays as a '-' but folds up the section
* Now click '-' on OTHER ISSUES again
* It unfolds and changes to '+' but surely when it is unfolded that would be plus mode so the sign is being shown for the opposite state?
fields.summary: +/- signs on outline TASK BOARD view aren't consistent

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
At the moment I can drag and drop issues when not in "Ranking" "Sort by" mode but they snap back to their previous position with no explanation of why ranking is not working. Is it possible to make it so we can rank at any time?

Hmm, I guess not, since when e.g. in priority sort mode and moving issue A above B I don't know what that must do to the ranking since A might already be above B in rank terms, just not in priority terms.

How about disabling drag-n-drop when not in ranking mode then?
fields.summary: Always allow ranking, not just when "Sort by" is "Ranking"

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: In list view on the PLANNING BOARD you are effectively looking at a table with rows and columns but that table has no header row indicating what the columns are. This can be a bit confusing if say your row indicates the component in one column but you don't have any components so one column is just a list of "Unknown". Unknown what?
fields.summary: Add header row to list view

fields.description: In my setup I can transition an issue in the IN PROGRESS column via a link on the top of the card to a new status that is also mapped to the IN PROGRESS column but has a resolution field on the transition screen. GH correctly prompts me to specify the resolution and I choose 'Won't Fix'. I then cause a second transition by dragging the card from IN PROGRESS to DONE and GH again correctly prompts me to specify the resolution because this transition also has a screen containing the resolution field. BUT the dialog has defaulted the resolution value to Fixed when my issue has resolution Won't Fix. This dialog should be an opportunity to update the resolution, but currently accepting the dialog causes the resolution to be overwritten (presumably by the JIRA default resolution).

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Right now GreenHopper tries to determine from the properties of JIRA issues which columns to display issues in.

What if we turned this on it's head and instead a JIRA custom select field were added to the project and could be set to a named column, e.g. IN PROGRESS or DONE for every issue.

GreenHopper could just cause workflow transitions and the custom field could be updated from workflow post functions.

You'd no longer need the mapping of what constitutes "Done" etc and presumably the work that GH has to do would be minimised. Also by using the JIRA workflow system more power would be handed to the end user to customise the business logic.

I haven't thought this through, but it strikes me as intriguing..

A major pro of this approach is that, to my mind at least, it more closely matches the real world. With a real white board there may be a clear set of rules behind where most of the sticky notes are placed, but the only thing that really determines where a sticky note is is the person who picks it up and puts it down again. Trying to base the column on logic is going to get ever more complex as witnessed by the discussion and changes on [GHS-408].
fields.summary: Blue sky: GreenHopper 4? An alternate approach?

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
One of my teams has a white board column "Waiting" which is used to indicate that the issue depends on another issue. I was trying to think of ways to implement this in GreenHopper (the most obvious being via a new workflow status or using the GH flagging feature) when it occured to me that I shouldn't need to add something GH can trigger on because the information is already part of the JIRA issue if the link is actually represented using the issue linking feature (e.g. A depends on B).

It would be cool if GreenHopper could indicate on a card any issue links that exist.

it would also be cool if GreenHopper could filter / highlight to show cards that have links vs those that don't.
fields.summary: Include issue linking info on cards & allow filter / highlight by issue linking status

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Moving an issue between versions currently gives you the option to change the version of subtasks of that issue. It would also be useful to be able to change the version of linked issues, that is issues that the parent issue links to. Perhaps further selected by the issue type. The use case for this is where people have requirement issues linked to task issues, but they are not using subtasks.
fields.summary: Add ability to change version of linked issues
